title: Power BI Ecosystem: Core and Specialized Components
description: Power BI is a suite of tools and services for collecting, transforming, visualizing, and sharing data insights. Here is a breakdown of the key products within the Power BI ecosystem.

items.title: Power BI Desktop
items.description: A free, Windows-based desktop application for data analysts and developers to create Power BI reports and data models.

details.label: Key Functions
items: Connect to various data sources
Transform and clean data using Power Query
Build data models (define relationships, create calculated columns and measures with DAX)
Design interactive reports with a wide range of visualizations

details.label: Usage
items: Primary tool for initial data work and report creation

items.title: Power BI Service
items.description: A cloud-based SaaS platform for publishing, sharing, and collaborating on Power BI reports and dashboards.

details.label: Key Functions
items: Online viewing and interaction with reports
Create dashboards (collections of visualizations from multiple reports)
Set up scheduled data refreshes
Manage user access and security
Use features like Q&A (natural language query) and data alerts

details.label: Licensing Tiers
items: Power BI (Free): Personal use, create reports, publish to personal workspace, limited sharing
Power BI Pro: Per-user subscription for sharing/collaboration, shared workspaces, more frequent refreshes
Power BI Premium Per User (PPU): Higher-tier per-user subscription with Premium features (larger datasets, paginated reports, AI, deployment pipelines)
Power BI Premium (Per Capacity): Enterprise-level, dedicated cloud capacity, broader sharing, advanced features for scale, performance, and governance

items.title: Power BI Mobile Apps
items.description: Mobile applications for iOS, Android, and Windows devices to access and interact with Power BI reports and dashboards on the go.

details.label: Key Functions
items: Access and interact with Power BI reports and dashboards
Optimized layouts for mobile screens

items.title: Power BI Report Server
items.description: An on-premises solution for organizations needing to keep Power BI and paginated reports within their own infrastructure.

details.label: Key Functions
items: Publish and manage Power BI reports on-premises
Similar to SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Alternative to Power BI Service for specific data residency/security needs

items.title: Power BI Report Builder
items.description: A standalone tool for creating paginated (pixel-perfect, printable) reports, often for operational reporting.

details.label: Key Functions
items: Design highly formatted, fixed-layout reports
Print or export reports
Publish to Power BI Service (with Premium) or Power BI Report Server

items.title: Power BI Embedded
items.description: A service for developers to embed Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations into custom applications or websites.

details.label: Key Functions
items: Integrate Power BI capabilities into software products
Provide interactive analytics to users without direct Power BI licenses
Pricing based on usage and capacity

items.title: Microsoft Fabric (and Power BI's role)
items.description: Microsoft Fabric is a unified analytics platform. Power BI is the visualization and business intelligence experience within Fabric.

details.label: Key Points
items: Fabric brings together data engineering, warehousing, science, real-time analytics, and BI in one platform
Power BI leverages the unified data lake (OneLake) and shared compute/governance
Many Premium features of Power BI are delivered through Fabric capacities
